DUTB pilotom Adrie predstavila načrte za novo družbo
07 Nov 2019, 16:58 by STA

Družba za upravljanje terjatev bank (DUTB) je po neuradnih informacijah Radia Slovenija nekdanjim pilotom Adrie Airways predstavila poslovni načrt nove slovenske letalske družbe, ki bi jo s partnerjem ustanovila država. Po načrtu - številke sicer naj ne bi bile zadnje - bi družba letela s petimi letali Canadair in imela do 200 zaposlenih.



Foto: Sta

LJUBLJANA > Nova družba bi imela po predstavljanem načrtu poleg tega zaradi vzpostavljanja letalske operacije prvo leto 20 milijonov evrov izgube, je neuradno izvedel radio in dodal, da to naj ne bi bile zadnje številke, saj izračuni še niso zaključeni.
Ali bo ustanovitev nove družbe, ki naj bi se po nekaterih informacijah imenovala Air Slovenia, podprla vlada, naj bi bilo znano do konca meseca, je še poročal Radio Slovenija.
“Stanje smo proučili”
V DUTB so danes STA na vprašanje o izračunih glede morebitnega novega državnega prevoznika povedali, da je bila DUTB “kot specialist za prestrukturiranje družb v težavah s strani ministrstva za gospodarstvo pozvana k proučitvi finančnega stanje družbe Adria Airways”. “Stanje smo proučili in o ugotovitvah obvestili ministrstvo. Več v tem trenutku ne moremo komentirati,” so zapisali.
Na podlagi analize finančnega stanja Adrie Airways se je vlada odločila, da v Adrio Airways ne bo vlagala denarja, je večkrat povedal gospodarski minister Zdravko Počivalšek. V intervjuju za tednik Mladina minulo sredo je povedal, da bodo izračuni pripravljeni “v kratkem”. Podrobnosti ni razkril, dejal je le, da je morebitni partner regionalni letalski prevoznik.
V DUTB so na vprašanja glede izračunov in glede predstavljanja poslovnega načrta nekdanjim pilotom Adrie odgovorili le, da “navedbe ne držijo”.
Na ministrstvu za gospodarski razvoj in tehnologijo so danes povedali, da od DUTB še niso prejeli izračunov glede morebitne ustanovitve novega letalskega prevoznika. “Ko bodo izračuni prispeli, jih bo ministrstvo proučilo in se do njih opredelilo,” so navedli.
Nezavezujoče ponudbe zbirajo do 11. novembra
Do nove družbe naj bi po navedbah radia sicer najlažje prišli z nakupom poslovne celote Adrie Airways, za katero stečajni upravitelj Janez Pustatičnik nezavezujoče ponudbe zbira do 11. novembra.
Morebitna ustanovitev novega letalskega podjetja je ena od možnosti, ki jo je za zagotavljanje povezljivosti Slovenije s svetom po stečaju Adrie Airways omenjala vlada. Stečaj Adrie Airways, ki jo je država leta 2016 prodala nemškemu skladu 4K Investments, je stekel 2. oktobra. Predlog za stečaj je vložilo vodstvo družbe, in sicer zaradi plačilne nesposobnosti.
Adria Airways, ki je imela okrog 550 zaposlenih, je na letališču Jožeta Pučnika opravila približno polovico vseh letov, po njenem propadu so v Ljubljano prišli Lufthansa, Swiss in Brussels Airlines, ki so vzpostavili lete v Frankfurt, München, Zürich in Bruselj.
text:
BAMC presented to Adria pilots plans for a new company
07 Nov 2019, 15:58 by STA

According to unofficial information from Radio Slovenia, the Bank Receivables Management Company (BAMC) presented to the former Adria Airways pilots a business plan for a new Slovenian airline, which would be set up with a partner by the state. According to the plan - although the numbers were not the last - the company would fly five Canadair aircraft and have up to 200 employees.



Photo: Sta

LJUBLJANA> According to the plan presented, the new company would have a loss of EUR 20 million in the first year due to the establishment of the flight operation, unofficially performed the radio, adding that these would not be the last figures, since the calculations had not yet been completed.
It is known by the end of the month whether the establishment of the new company, which is to be called Air Slovenia, will be supported by the government, Radio Slovenia reported.
“We studied the situation”
Asked about calculations regarding a possible new state-owned carrier, BAMC today said that BAMC was "called upon to examine Adria Airways' financial position as a specialist in restructuring companies in difficulty by the Ministry of the Economy". “We have examined the situation and informed the ministry of the findings. We cannot comment further at this time, ”they wrote.
Based on an analysis of the financial position of Adria Airways, the government has decided not to invest money in Adria Airways, said Economy Minister Zdravko Počivalšek on several occasions. In an interview with Mladina last Wednesday, he said the calculations would be prepared "shortly". He did not divulge the details, only saying that the potential partner is a regional air carrier.
In the BAMC, the questions regarding the calculations and the presentation of the business plan to the former Adria pilots were answered only by saying that "the statements are not true".
The Ministry of Economic Development and Technology said today that no calculations had been received from BAMC regarding the possible creation of a new air carrier. "When the calculations arrive, the ministry will examine them and decide on them," they said.
Non-binding offers are due by November 11th
According to the radio, the new company is most likely to be reached through the acquisition of the Adria Airways business unit, for which bankruptcy trustee Janez Pustaticnik is collecting non-binding offers until November 11.
The eventual establishment of a new airline is one of the options mentioned by the government to ensure Slovenia's connectivity with the world after the bankruptcy of Adria Airways. Adria Airways' bankruptcy, which the state sold in 2016 to the German 4K Investments Fund, came to an end on October 2. The bankruptcy filing was filed by the company management for insolvency.
Adria Airways, which had about 550 employees, made about half of all flights at Jože Pučnik Airport, following its collapse Lufthansa, Swiss and Brussels Airlines arrived in Ljubljana, establishing flights to Frankfurt, Munich, Zurich and Brussels.
